title.narrative: OUTPUT 24: EQUITABLE RESOURCE ALLOCATION

description.narrative: Effective tools and strategies are in place to improve the equitability of national resource allocation, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

participating-org.narrative: OFFICE OF RESEARCH INNOVATION AND DEVELOPMENT ORID

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective tools and strategies are in place to improve the equitability of national resource allocation

description.narrative: UNICEF partnered with Cornerstone Economic Research to provide a training workshop on social sector costing as part of capacity building support to the MoF.; UNICEF in partnership with the social sector MDAs, develop budget briefs;to help advocate for equitable resource allocation and increased social sector investments. The budget briefs;also provided recommendations;to support government’s efforts at:addressing PFM challenges;improving;service delivery for children, women and vulnerable groupssafe-guarding allocations for the social sector MDAs for COVID-19 interventions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2022
